Reporting Railroad Name: Southern New Jersey Light Rail Group
Maintenance Railroad Name: Southern New Jersey Light Rail Group
Primary Accident Cause: Highway user cited for violation of highway-rail grade crossing traffic laws
Accident Cause: Highway user cited for violation of highway-rail grade crossing traffic laws
Narrative: ON SATURDAY, FEBRUARY 19, 2011 AT APPROXIMATELY 11 32 HOURS, TRAIN #246 LRV 3508, REPORTED COLLIDINGWITH AN AUTOMOBILE THAT WAS FOULING THE TRACK AT NECK ROAD GRADE CROSSING IN BURLINGTON TOWNSHIP. TRAIN 3246 WAS A SINGLE UNIT CONSIST, PROCEEDING NORTHBOUND (RAILROAD DIRECTION), WITH FIFTY (50) PASSENGERS ON BOARD. THERE WERE NO (0) INJURIES REPORTED BY THE LRV OPERATOR, OR THE DRIVER OF THE AUTOMOBILE.NEW JERSEY TRANSIT POLICE WAS ON THE SCENE. THE REPORT NUMBER FOR THIS INCIDENT IS 1101537. THE LRV SUSTAINED MINOR DAMAGE TO THE ELECTRICAL COUPLER HEAD AND ANTICLIMBER COVER AS WELL. AS DAMAGE TO THE FIBERGLASS CAR BODY END CAP. ALL SYSTEMS FUNCTIONED ACCORDING TO DESIGN WITH THE ACTIVATIONOF THE GRADE CROSSING WARNING SYSTEMS INCLUDING GATES, BELLS, AND FLASHERS. THE LRB BRAKING SYSTEMFUNCTIONED ACCORDING TO DESIGN. A DOWNLOAD OF LRV DATA RECORDER SYSTEM SHOWS THAT THE TRAIN HORN ASSOUNDED IN EMERGENCY IN ADDITION TO BEING SOUNDED IN APPROACH OF THE CROSSING. THE PONTIAC GRAND PRIX WITH A MALE DRIVER HAD BEEN HEADING EASTBOUND ON NECK ROAD. ALTHOUGH THE RAIL CROSSING LIGHTS WEREFLASHING, THE BELL RINGING, AND THE GATES WERE IN THE FULLY DOWN POSITION, THE DRIVER OF THE AUTOMOBILE DROVE AROUND THE WEST SIDE GATE INTO THE CROSSING AREA WHILE THE TRAIN WAS APPROACHING THE CROSSING. THE AUTOMOBILE STOP IN THE CROSSING AREA WITH THE REAR SIDE IN THE PATH OF LRV 3508. THE LRV OPERATOR SOUNDED HORN AND APPLIED EMERGENCY BRAKE. WITH THE EMERGENCY BRAKING IN PROGRESS, THE LRV OP
Reporting Parent Railroad Company Name: Southern New Jersey Light Rail Group
